steps.description: Customer searches for hotel availability by location, dates, and number of guests.
steps.businessRationale: Search is the highest-volume and most revenue-sensitive operation; customers expect fast results to avoid abandonment.

steps.description: Customer selects a room type and rate plan (Standard, Flex, Meal Deal).
steps.businessRationale: Room and rate selection directly influence revenue; add-ons and flexible rates increase margin.

steps.description: Customer enters personal details, payment information, and confirms the booking.
steps.businessRationale: Payment is the highest-value conversion step; failures directly reduce revenue.

steps.description: Customer receives confirmation, checks booking details, and may add extras such as breakfast or parking.
steps.businessRationale: Pre-stay engagement increases add-on revenue and reduces customer support load.

steps.description: Customer checks in at the hotel and experiences their stay.
steps.businessRationale: Check-in experience strongly influences satisfaction and future booking likelihood.

steps.description: Customer receives a post-stay email and submits feedback or a review.
steps.businessRationale: Feedback drives reputation, NPS, and future conversion rates; reviews influence organic acquisition.
